numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that a legacy applicant has at least a doubled chance of admission.
2. I noticed that the chance of admission increases when the income rank of the parents increases.
3. I noticed that a student has a lower chance of admission if the income rank of the parents is the 50th rank.
4. The 50th rank is a middle income rank.
5. I wonder why a legacy student has a lower chance of admission if the income rank of the parents is the 50th rank.
6. I wonder why this chance is lower than the chance of other legacy students with a lower income rank.
7. I wonder why this chance is lower than the chance of other legacy students with a higher income rank.
8. I ask whether the graph indicates an abundance of legacy students whose parents have the 50th income rank.
9. I ask whether middle-class people experience discrimination in the college admission process.
10. I ask whether the situation involves injustice.
11. I ask whether the situation involves high demand.
12. This relates to my community in many ways.
13. I am currently in high school.
14. I plan to go to college.
15. College is not the goal for all high school students.
16. Many high school students have future plans that include going to college.
17. Most people around me are academically motivated.
18. Most people around me try very hard to appear appealing to colleges.
19. We strive to get good grades.
20. We fill our schedules with clubs.
21. We fill our schedules with extracurricular activities.
22. We keep a social life at the same time.
23. We are in high school.
24. The headline is: Are the chances of being admitted to college connected to income and legacy?
